info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 1:02AM EDT until May 13 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Rockingham and south central Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Martinsville and Henry.
* WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area, especially in the Martinsville area. Up to 1.5 to 2.0 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jordan Creek, Flippins Creek, Home Creek, Fishing Fork, Hairston Branch, Crab Creek, Leatherwood Creek, Grassy Fork, Cascade Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Martinsville... Axton... Bassett... Ridgeway... Chatmoss... Laurel Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
